altUpDownArrows.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/183101?hl=en#pageshortcuts. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

appearDistance.description: In other words, “distance after which the button appears.”

askingToRateLinkTooltip.description: Message encouraging user to rate the extension.
askingToRateLinkTooltip.message:
Do you like this extension?

Let others know what you like the most!
Rate it now

breakingChangesUpgradingVersion8Message.description: Message/warning displayed to users who had had version 8 of the extension before. Context:
breakingChangesUpgradingVersion8Message.message:
IMPORTANT:
Breaking changes when upgrading from version 8!
Please go to Options for details.

brokenOnUnsupportedSetting.description: Message displayed for a possible error when handling (for example, saving) the settings.
brokenOnUnsupportedSetting.message: 'A broken or an unsupported setting (option) detected.'

browserActionPageTitle.message: Active tab settings | Scroll To Top Button

buttonDisplaySettings.description: Heading for the group of settings related to the look and feel of the button.

buttonDisplaySettingsTooltip.description: Tooltip for the button display settings.
buttonDisplaySettingsTooltip.message: Settings related to the look and feel of the button(s).

buttonHeightCustom.description: Lets user specify button height value in pixels instead of selecting a pre-set size.

buttonModeAdvanced.description: Group of button modes that don't require any special permissions during installation or while in use. Since these modes don't have those permissions, the feature scope is limited. User first needs to click the extension icon, which adds the scroll button(s) onto the page. Context:
buttonModeAdvanced.message: No button on page until click | Advanced

buttonModeAdvancedBrowserActionTitle.description: Tooltip of the extension icon next to the address bar when an advanced button mode is selected in Options. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72518776-dd309b00-380a-11ea-81d8-e229571b71ba.png
buttonModeAdvancedBrowserActionTitle.message:
$EXTENSION_NAME$ v$EXTENSION_VERSION$

Click to add button(s) to currently active page*.
Right-click (open context menu) to find Options.


$BREAKING_CHANGES_MESSAGE$* Might not work on some pages/websites:
Please don't leave a negative review.
Instead, let us know – we might be able to fix.

breaking_changes_message.example:
IMPORTANT:
Breaking changes when upgrading from version 8!
Please go to Options for details.

buttonModeAdvancedDescription.description: Description of a group of button modes that don't require any special permissions during installation or while in use. Since these modes don't have those permissions, the feature scope is limited. User first needs to click the extension icon, which adds the scroll button(s) onto the page. Context:
buttonModeAdvancedDescription.message: To scroll page, add the button(s) onto page by clicking the extension icon next to the address bar.

buttonModeBasic.description: Group of button modes that don't require any special permissions during installation or while in use. Since these modes don't have those permissions, the feature scope is limited. Scrolling is triggered by clicking the extension icon. Context:

buttonModeBasicBrowserActionTitle.description: Tooltip of the extension icon next to the address bar when a basic button mode is selected in Options. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72518629-9e024a00-380a-11ea-9d59-90b858f0aa0c.png
buttonModeBasicBrowserActionTitle.message:
$EXTENSION_NAME$ v$EXTENSION_VERSION$

Click to scroll*.
Right-click (open context menu) to find Options.


$BREAKING_CHANGES_MESSAGE$* Might not work on some pages/websites:
Please don't leave a negative review.
Instead, let us know – we might be able to fix.

breaking_changes_message.example:
IMPORTANT:
Breaking changes when upgrading from version 8!
Please go to Options for details.

buttonModeBasicDescription.description: Description of a group of button modes that don't require any special permissions during installation or while in use. Since these modes don't have those permissions, the feature scope is limited. Scrolling is triggered by clicking the extension icon. Context:
buttonModeBasicDescription.message: To scroll page, click the extension icon next to the address bar.

buttonModeBrowserActionButtonTitle.message: Scroll to top of this page

buttonModeExpert.description: Group of button modes that require special permissions (“tabs” - allows disabling the extension on a whole domain or a specific URL; “<all_urls>” for content_scripts - adds a button(s) to the specified location of a page in the specified design, size, and other properties) to be granted. Allows to have the scroll button(s) always on page. Context:
buttonModeExpert.message: Button always on page + button settings | Expert

buttonModeExpertBrowserActionTitle.description: Tooltip of the extension icon next to the address bar when an expert button mode is selected in Options. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72518945-40223200-380b-11ea-9856-cbbb78f00edf.png
buttonModeExpertBrowserActionTitle.message:
$EXTENSION_NAME$ v$EXTENSION_VERSION$

Click to open active tab settings.
Right-click (open context menu) to find Options.


$BREAKING_CHANGES_MESSAGE$Extension might not work on some pages/websites:
Please don't leave a negative review.
Instead, let us know – we might be able to fix.

breaking_changes_message.example:
IMPORTANT:
Breaking changes when upgrading from version 8!
Please go to Options for details.

buttonModeExpertDescription.description: Description of a group of button modes that require special permissions (“tabs” - allows disabling the extension on a whole domain or a specific URL; “<all_urls>” for content_scripts - adds a button(s) to the specified location of a page in the specified design, size, and other properties) to be granted. Allows to have the scroll button(s) always on page. Context:
buttonModeExpertDescription.message:
To scroll page, use the on-page button(s).
This mode allows button customizations.
This used to be the only option before version 9 released in January 2020.

buttonSettings.description: (Deprecated: this string is not used at the moment, but might get reused in the future.) Settings of the button(s) that appears on the page when the button mode is set to one from the Advanced or Expert group.

buttonSizeInPixels.description: Button size in pixels (length, width): 35x40 pixels

buttonWidthCustom.description: Lets user specify button width value in pixels instead of selecting a pre-set size.

clickthroughKeys.description: Before, user might have wanted to click an element located underneath/behind the button, but the button was in the way and there was no way to get rid of the button. Now, such user can hold a certain key on his/her keyboard and hover over the button and the button will disappear, allowing the user to comfortably click the previously inaccessible element.

clickthroughKeysTooltip.description: The tooltip that explains the “clickthrough keys” option in detail.
clickthroughKeysTooltip.message:
Before, you might have wanted to click an element located underneath/behind the button, but the button was in the way and there was no way to get rid of the button.

Now, you can hold a certain key on your keyboard and hover over the button and the button will disappear, allowing you to comfortably click the previously inaccessible element.

closeModal.description: Text of a button that closes a modal.

containerStyleAttributeRepeatedChangesIs.description: When a third-party script (the current page's or another extension's) is messing with the button's container's style attribute, adding unwanted rules, then user is presented with a dialog asking user to submit an issue report to the developer. User is also advised that this issue might lead to an increase in CPU usage.
containerStyleAttributeRepeatedChangesIs.message:
A website script or another extension (addon) is trying to change the look of Scroll To Top Button.

$DEBUGGING_INFORMATION_CONFIRMATION$

To help resolve the issue sooner, please consider including a list of the installed extensions in your browser.

If the issue persists, you might see increased CPU usage.


PoziWorld,
developer of Scroll To Top Button extension

debugging_information_confirmation.example:
Press OK to send the following: Variable 1 key: variable 1 value
Variable 2 key: variable 2 value

contextRightClickMenu.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/183101?hl=en. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

ctrlKey.description: Ctrl (Control on Macintosh keyboards) key + Click button.

ctrlKeyOrShiftKey.description: Ctrl (Control on Macintosh keyboards) or Shift key + Click button.

custom.description: Shows a number input field that lets user specify scroll up speed value in milliseconds instead of selecting a pre-set one.

debuggingInformationConfirmation.description: When there is an issue starting the extension in an Expert-type mode user selected in the Options, then user is presented with a dialog asking user to submit an issue report to the developer. User is also advised that the preferred Expert-type mode can be enabled in the Options again.
debuggingInformationConfirmation.message:
Press OK to report the issue in a new tab with the following debugging information included.

It will be helpful if you also provide your email, so we can get in touch with you to get more details and/or notify you when the issue is resolved.
$DEBUGGING_INFORMATION$

debugging_information.example:
Variable 1 key: variable 1 value
Variable 2 key: variable 2 value

disableExpertButtonModes.description: Title of a button that triggers a revocation of the previously granted permissions (“tabs” - allows disabling the extension on a whole domain or a specific URL; “<all_urls>” for content_scripts - adds a button(s) to the specified location of a page in the specified design, size, and other properties). Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71878081-aa3a2900-30df-11ea-8be1-393dcf6578d0.png

dislike.description: Message (currently, a “thumbs down” emoji) asking user to contact developer if that user is not (completely) satisfied with the extension.

dualArrows.description: Name of a button mode that allows scrolling to the top or bottom of a page. Always shows two arrows. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

expertModeActivationIssue.description: When there is an issue starting the extension in an Expert-type mode user selected in the Options, then user is presented with a dialog asking user to submit an issue report to the developer. User is also advised that the preferred Expert-type mode can be enabled in the Options again.
expertModeActivationIssue.message:
There was an issue activating an Expert mode.

$DEBUGGING_INFORMATION_CONFIRMATION$

While developer is looking into the issue, you can re-enable an Expert mode in Options.

Sorry for the inconvenience.

debugging_information_confirmation.example:
Press OK to send the following: Variable 1 key: variable 1 value
Variable 2 key: variable 2 value

exportedSettingsNotOfExpectedFormat.description: When user tries to export the extension settings, the extension first checks whether the format of settings is of an expected format. And, if not, the export process terminates and an error message is shown to the user.
exportedSettingsNotOfExpectedFormat.message: Failed to export settings. Please try reloading the page. If the problem persists, please notify the developer via $ISSUE_REPORTING_LINK$

exportedSettingsPreviewElementMissing.description: When user tries to export the extension settings, the extension is expected to show a preview of the exported settings in the text format. If the page element for the preview is missing, the export process terminates and an error message is shown to the user.
exportedSettingsPreviewElementMissing.message: Failed to show a preview of the exported settings. Please try reloading the page. If the problem persists, please notify the developer via $ISSUE_REPORTING_LINK$

extensionDescription.description: In other words, “Adds a button (that allows) to scroll to top or bottom.”
extensionDescription.message: Scroll to top, bottom, or both. Click extension icon, on-page button, use context menu options, and/or keyboard shortcuts.

extensionName.description: Please copy and paste the original/source string. Should NOT be translated.

extensionReloadConfirmationMessage.description: If an Options change requires an extension restart, ask user whether he/she wants to do it now.
extensionReloadConfirmationMessage.message: Would you like to restart the extension now to apply the changes?

extensionReloadIssue.description: When there is an issue reloading the extension, then user is presented with a dialog asking user to submit an issue report to the developer. User is also advised to close and open the browser again to apply the changes.
extensionReloadIssue.message:
There was an issue reloading the extension.

$DEBUGGING_INFORMATION_CONFIRMATION$

While developer is looking into the issue, you can close your browser and open it again to apply the changes.

Sorry for the inconvenience.

debugging_information_confirmation.example:
Press OK to send the following: Variable 1 key: variable 1 value
Variable 2 key: variable 2 value

flipBetweenTopBottom.description: The “flip” is when the button changes the direction: when you scroll down, the arrow points towards the top; when you scroll up, the arrow points towards the bottom. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

flipDistance.description: The “flip” is when the button changes the direction: when you scroll down, the arrow points towards the top; when you scroll up, the arrow points towards the bottom.

genericContactFormLinkText.description: Text of a link to contact developer about an issue/bug and/or with a suggestion/question/other feedback.

hadVersion8InstalledBeforeMessage.description: Message displayed to existing users when their extension gets updated from version 8 to version 9. Context:
hadVersion8InstalledBeforeMessage.message: Dear $EXTENSION_NAME$ user, To give all users a choice of improved security, the following changes to the way the extension works were made in version 9 (compared to version 8 and earlier): To install, it now does not need any permissions. For existing users, unfortunately, there was no way for us to keep the permissions you had granted upon the installation. To restore how it used to work, please enable one of the expert button modes. Or, you can give a try to the new basic and advanced button modes, which work without any permissions. We deeply apologize for the inconvenience. Your trust and support have always been paramount to us. Technical details of the changes: . PoziWorld, developer of $EXTENSION_NAME$

hadVersion8InstalledBeforeMessageAcknowl.description: Acknowledgement call-to-action (button) text for the message displayed to existing users when their extension gets updated from version 8 to version 9. Context:
hadVersion8InstalledBeforeMessageAcknowl.message: Okay, I will check the expert button modes

hadVersion8InstalledBeforeMessageRemoval.description: Text of a call-to-action (button) that removes the message displayed to existing users when their extension gets updated from version 8 to version 9. Context:

infiniteScrollDownRecheckDelay.message: Delay to check for ability to continue scrolling

infiniteScrollDownRecheckDelayActiveIndi.message:
When the extension is waiting (see the delay setting above) to recheck whether more content will have been loaded, it can show an indicator underneath the button.

The indicator should look like the infinity symbol (∞).

infiniteScrollDownRecheckDelayTooltip.message: If the infinite scrolling enabled website hadn't loaded more content by the time the extension finished scrolling down, the extension will wait the number of milliseconds specified by this setting to check again whether more content will have been loaded, in which case the extension will continue scrolling down.

infiniteScrollDownTooltip.message:
Some websites, such as Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and Quora, keep loading more content as you scroll down.

Enabling this setting makes the extension check whether the page height has increased while the scroll was in-progress, which most likely would mean more content got loaded, and if that is the case then the extension can continue scrolling down.

Tip: you can stop the in-progress (infinite) scrolling by clicking the “Scroll down” button.

issueReportingLinkTooltip.description: Message encouraging user to contact developer.
issueReportingLinkTooltip.message:
Something is not working?
Found a bug?
Have a question?
Something else?

Contact the extension developer now

keyboardOnly.description: Name of a button mode that allows scrolling to the top or bottom of a page only with the help of keyboard shortcuts. No button(s) present on the page. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

keyboardShortcuts.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/157179?hl=en. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

language_bg.description:
Language option: bg (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes).

If it doesn't match the current language, then write: *name of this language in the current language* - *native name of this language*.
If it does match the current language, then write: *native name of this language*.

Examples:
If the current language isn't English (United States) but Russian, this should say: Английский (Соединённые Штаты) - English (United States).
If the current language is English (United States), this should match it: English (United States).

language_browserDefault.description:
Language option.

If the extension supports the language that is chosen as default in the browser, use that one. Otherwise, use English (United States).

language_browserDefault_tooltip.description: Explanation of the “Automatic (browser default)” language option that should be shown in a tooltip.
language_browserDefault_tooltip.message: If the extension supports the language that is chosen as default in the browser, use that one. Otherwise, use English (United States).

like.description: Message (currently, a “thumbs up” emoji) asking user to indicate whether that user is satisfied with the extension.

notActiveButtonOpacity.description: In other words, “Opacity of inactive button.”

officialWebsite.description: It might be called an “official website”, but since it's more of a landing page (for now) than a full website calling it just a “homepage” seems reasonable.

operatingSystem.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/177889?hl=en. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

optionsTitle.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/7040464?hl=en. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

permissionDetailsOrigins.description: Name and description of the permission used to add the button(s) itself, its logic, and its design properties onto all websites. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72318802-2ab5d800-3652-11ea-9181-215d491cf244.png
permissionDetailsOrigins.message: “$PERMISSION_NAME$” is used to add the button(s) itself, its logic, and its design properties onto all websites without extra actions from you.

permission_name.example: Read and change all your data on the websites you visit

permissionDetailsTabs.description:
Name and description of the permission used to check the URL of a tab:
1) There are some default websites where the button doesn't get added because it wouldn't work there (for example, Google Docs and Google Sheets).
2) User has the ability to disable the button(s) on any website (example.org) or URL (example.org/blog?page=1) by clicking the extension icon next to the address bar and selecting the appropriate option. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72318802-2ab5d800-3652-11ea-9181-215d491cf244.png
permissionDetailsTabs.message:
“$PERMISSION_NAME$” is used to check the URL of a tab:
1) There are some default websites where the button doesn't get added because it wouldn't work there (for example, Google Docs and Google Sheets).
2) You have the ability to disable the button(s) on any website (example.org) or URL (example.org/blog?page=1) by clicking the extension icon next to the address bar and selecting the appropriate option.

permissionNameOriginsChromium.description: Chromium-based browsers-specific name of the permission used to add the button(s) itself, its logic, and its design properties onto all websites. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72318977-ae6fc480-3652-11ea-8407-96e6b2909ee3.png
permissionNameOriginsChromium.message: Read and change all your data on the websites you visit

permissionNameOriginsFirefox.description: Firefox-specific name of the permission used to add the button(s) itself, its logic, and its design properties onto all websites. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72318802-2ab5d800-3652-11ea-9181-215d491cf244.png
permissionNameOriginsFirefox.message: Access your data for all websites

2) User has the ability to disable the button(s) on any website (example.org) or URL (example.org/blog?page=1) by clicking the extension icon next to the address bar and selecting the appropriate option. permissionsCheckIssue.description: When there is an issue checking for the required permissions, then user is presented with a dialog asking user to submit an issue report to the developer. User is also advised that the preferred Expert-type mode can be enabled in the Options again.
permissionsCheckIssue.message:
There was an issue checking for the required permissions.

$DEBUGGING_INFORMATION_CONFIRMATION$

While developer is looking into the issue, you can re-enable an Expert mode in Options, if you had one enabled before.

Sorry for the inconvenience.

Variable 2 key: variable 2 value

permissionsListExplanation.description: A sentence that is followed by a list of individual permissions and their descriptions. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72318802-2ab5d800-3652-11ea-9181-215d491cf244.png
permissionsListExplanation.message: The following permissions are required for the expert button modes – modes that work by adding the button(s) onto all pages unless you choose to disable it for certain pages or websites:

permissionsRequestIssue.description: When there is an issue with user's request for the permissions, then user is presented with a dialog asking user to submit an issue report to the developer. User is also advised to make the request again.
permissionsRequestIssue.message:
There was an issue with your request for the permissions.

$DEBUGGING_INFORMATION_CONFIRMATION$

While developer is looking into the issue, you can try requesting the permissions again.

Sorry for the inconvenience.

debugging_information_confirmation.example:
Press OK to send the following: Variable 1 key: variable 1 value
Variable 2 key: variable 2 value

privacyDetails.description: Re-affirmation that the extension doesn't steal user's data. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72318802-2ab5d800-3652-11ea-9181-215d491cf244.png
privacyDetails.message: This extension does not read, change, store, or transmit any of your personal data (e.g., logins, passwords, messages, contacts) from any of the sites or your computer in absolutely any form.

scrollDownSpeedCustom.description: Lets user specify scroll up speed value in milliseconds instead of selecting a pre-set one.

scrollSettings.description: Heading for the group of settings related to the scrolling of the page, such as the scrolling speed and when the button should appear when the scrolling starts.

scrollSettingsTooltip.message: Settings related to the scrolling of the page, such as the scrolling speed and when the button should appear when the scrolling starts.

scrollToBottomOnly.description: Name of a button mode that allows scrolling only to the bottom of a page.

scrollToBottomOnlyBasicContextMenuItemTi.description: Title of a context (right-click) menu item, which scrolls page to its bottom. Name of the button mode and its group (in parentheses).

scrollToTopOnly.description: Name of a button mode that allows scrolling only to the top of a page. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

scrollToTopOnlyBasicContextMenuItemTitle.description: Title of a context (right-click) menu item, which scrolls page to its top. Name of the button mode and its group (in parentheses). Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/73048563-6f99f580-3e2e-11ea-9b6a-a2cae9526f1b.png

scrollUpSpeedCustom.description: Lets user specify scroll up speed value in milliseconds instead of selecting a pre-set one.

sourceCodeOpenlyAvailableDetails.description: Statement that the extension has nothing to hide. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/72318802-2ab5d800-3652-11ea-9181-215d491cf244.png
sourceCodeOpenlyAvailableDetails.message: Free extension. Code available for your review at https://github.com/PoziWorld/Scroll-To-Top-Button-extension

translatedBy.description: To give translators proper credit, this will be displayed somewhere on the Options page, so that people know who translated it for them. Example: “Translated by John Doe aka johndoesttb”

uiLanguage.description: Setting on the Options page: language of the user interface.

versionAndLicense.description: Shows the extension name, extension version, and license information. “fair-code” and “Sustainable Use License” shouldn't be translated.
versionAndLicense.message: $EXTENSION_NAME$ v$EXTENSION_VERSION$ is [fair-code]($FAIR_CODE_URL$) distributed under the [Sustainable Use License]($SUSTAINABLE_USE_LICENSE_URL$)

watchDemo.description: Link/button that opens/triggers a URL/page/modal featuring a demo (video).
